reviews.review_msg: The class was stress free. Easy to communicate with the instrucor. I enjoyed the class it relates to the real world.

I barely studied taking Regional geography of Canada with him. Was taking hist 1114 with another prof and he was repeating half the stuff in the other course. So I never even bothered.  Was taking this guy At Kwantlen. Course was boring as the material was being repeated. Basically coasted without much studying at all. His tests are easy.
Very approachable, very friendly. Tests include some thinking questions, but all of the questions are reasonable.

Easy, if you took good notes/reviewed the slides, you'd get a good mark. If you had questions which exceeded the info presented, he was rather off put and rude answering the student's question (if he actually answered it). maybe 500 person lectures just weren't his thing but he seemed bored most of the time.
Great proff- very helpful and he really does want you to succeed.

417 is a writing intensive course for physical geog major students. It teaches you how to write proper scientific reports. Khaled was helpful and available for extra help outside of the class (and i learned that he was preparing for his PhD defense during that time)...I think he is a really good instructor
He delivered the materials in a nice and simple way. He was so helpful during lab tutorials.

Makes mistakes in lecture, accent can be difficult, just reads his slides. He's not responsive to feedback and answers without understanding your question (akes you feel stupid for asking). Midterm was writing intensive, took the entire time period, and required more than was covered in lecture. Lecture material was easy. Labs okay but unclear.

Grad student. Cannot communicate effectively, so course content, interaction, and student learning suffer.  Take equivalent BISC 204 instead, or wait for a non-sessional instructor. He means well, but he is just not adequately responsive to questions/discussions (lacks communication skills). Disappointing and substandard for university.
He's nice enought but I find I have to concentrate to understand his acccent sometimes (especially when he's using jargon or terms)
